text: <@U0XPR4NP4> - done and merged
Fixes in Couch tests ready for +2 reviews: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4591/>
done
Thanks.  Also some refactoring to enable history of keys on leveldb: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4603/>
Got a series coming in, but for now: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4615/> (a changeset that got merged a couple of hours ago breaks the master)
<@U0XQ35CDD> - then why did CI pass for those change sets?
<@U0PB67X4K>: The changeset that got merged today had the old constructor definition.

What's interesting is that yesterday's changeset (the one that turned the constructor into a 3-argument function), got merged yesterday at 15:17. And the changeset that got merged today (the one using the 2-argument function) got _pushed_ yesterday at 16:14, i.e. after the other one got merged.
somehow it must have thought the "old" was "new"
So I'm not sure how fast-forwarding took place.
Yeah. Maybe <@U0UHG4VP1> can shed some light here.
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2991/> could use some lovin'
<@U0PB67X4K> <@U0XQ35CDD> which change?
<@U0KM61BCP>: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4615/> (commit msg has links inside)
weird
<@U0XQ35CDD>: I will look when I'm home.
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4637/> needs love - easy one
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4643/> for SDK to use a “standard MSP config” to load pre-provisioned users in terms of keys and certs
<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0PB67X4K> pls review: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4107/>
<@U0KM61BCP> regarding <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4637/>, I assume that Dockerfile was inadvertently committed ?
curious why you chose to have 3 images rather than just create multiple layers?
ah yes
I'll fix that and add the ignore
The short term plan is: the places that are currently using "fabric-runtime" will use fabric-baseos
this means, baseos, basejvm, and baseimage would be in dockerhub
longer term, I would also be cleaning up some of the java stuff to utilize basejvm

<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F3V7RCH38/patch_for_fabric_git_under_development.sh|patch for fabric.git under development> and commented: <@U0KM61BCP>

text: that captures the gist of it
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4637/>

<@U0KPFAZNF> I guess what I am asking is why create 3 images that each build from the predecessor as opposed to simply having one image that has multiple layers built from the same RUN command sequences
Maybe I am missing something, but I want discrete "FROM" targets
See the fabric.git patch I posted and look for how I used "baseos"
the baseos I think I get
I'm not sure how I would achieve same effect via layers
But open to suggestion
At some point I'd like to explore making baseos derived from alpine, at least for x86
But that can be for another day
do we have a use for the jvm image independent of the baseimage?
At some point soon, I'll build chaincode in a similar manner as we do for peer/orderer
I'll use basejvm for Java chaincode
It might also be useful for chaintool, tbd
By all this, I mean the process of building in one container and then injecting the result into a minimal container
Golang->baseos, Java -> basejvm
The critical split is baseos/baseimage for right now
But figured I'd tackle all three while in there
hmm.  <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4627/3>  .  I didn't have a chance to look at the latest patch set until now.  Please see my comments.  Looks like we'll need to patch the patch.
